name: Physalis solanum vesicarium

Head: Dryness of mouth
Facial paralysis
Vertigo, hazy feeling; memory weakened; desire to talk constantly
Throbbing pain, heavy over eyes in forehead
Fever: Sweat during stool, with creeping sensation, with abundant urine
Urine: Sudden inability to hold it in women
Respiratory: Hoarse voice; throat irritated; chest oppressed, causing insomnia
Skin: Excoriation between fingers and toes; pustules on thighs; nodes on forehead
Extremities: When walking, every jar seems repeated in the head

details: Marked urinary symptoms confirming its ancient uses in gravel, etc. Lithiasis; marked diuretic action. Languor and muscular weakness. Recommended in facial paralysis.
dosage: Tincture to third attenuation. The juice of the berries is used in dropsical conditions and irritable bladder.
